note_text:
S: 71M with NSCLC, needs mediastinal staging before resection
O: EBUS performed under moderate sedation (midaz 3mg, fent 75mcg). Ramsay 3.
   Vitals stable, BP q5min, SpO2 96-99% on 2L NC.
   Stations: 4R 11mm (PET+) x4 passes ROSE+, 7 subcarinal 14mm (PET+) x4 ROSE+,
   10R 7mm x3 ROSE adequate. Systematic N3-N2-N1 done. Photos all stations.
A: N2 disease confirmed bilevel (4R, 7). Adequate molecular tissue.
P: Present at tumor board. Likely neoadjuvant chemo.
Name: Harold Kim | MRN GH-4829-P | DOB 04/12/1953
Complications: none

note_text:
PATIENT: Susan M. O'Brien
MRN: HUP-2025-7734  
DOB: July 4, 1961 (64 years old)
DATE: November 2, 2025
LOCATION: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA
PROCEDURALIST: Dr. Michael Steinberg, MD, FCCP
ASSISTANT: Dr. Rachel Kim, DO (IP Fellow)

INDICATION FOR PROCEDURE:
Ms. O'Brien is a delightful 64-year-old former librarian who presents with right middle lobe peripheral nodule discovered on CT performed for evaluation of persistent cough. Initial imaging demonstrated 2.4 cm spiculated nodule in right middle lobe lateral segment with pleural retraction. PET scan showed intense uptake with SUV max 13.4. Navigational bronchoscopy with radial EBUS-guided biopsy confirmed poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma. 

Patient has complicated medical history including chronic kidney disease stage 4 (not on dialysis, baseline creatinine 2.9), chronic systolic heart failure (EF 30%), and severe osteoporosis with multiple compression fractures. Thoracic surgery evaluation determined patient to be extremely high risk for lobectomy with estimated perioperative mortality exceeding 15%. Radiation oncology consulted but patient declined stereotactic body radiation therapy after extensive discussion, preferring bronchoscopic intervention.

PROCEDURE DESCRIPTION:
I met with Ms. O'Brien and her husband in the pre-procedure area. We reviewed the nature of the procedure, expected benefits, and potential risks including but not limited to bleeding, infection, pneumothorax, respiratory failure, need for chest tube placement, bronchopleural fistula, and possible need for surgical intervention for complications. We also discussed the possibility that ablation may not completely treat the tumor and that additional therapies might be necessary. Patient and family demonstrated excellent understanding and provided informed consent.

Patient brought to bronchoscopy suite at 0815. Anesthesiology team (Dr. Paul Reynolds attending) present. Standard monitoring established. Given comorbidities and anticipated procedure duration, decision made for general anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.

Following induction and intubation with 8.0 ETT, therapeutic bronchoscope advanced revealing normal appearing airway anatomy throughout. No endobronchial lesions, external compressions, or dynamic collapse noted.

Electromagnetic navigation initiated using Medtronic superDimension system with prior CT imaging from 10/20/2025. Planning performed identifying target in RML lateral segment. Registration achieved with 8 reference points yielding registration accuracy of 3.1mm.

Guide sheath (8.0 Fr) navigated to peripheral target location. Due to RML anatomy with somewhat straight trajectory, navigation was relatively straightforward requiring approximately 8 minutes. Radial EBUS performed confirming target lesion in solid contact position. Lesion appeared as heterogeneous hypoechoic mass measuring approximately 24 x 21mm.

Cone-beam CT performed confirming guide sheath position within acceptable range of target (7mm from center). Pleural surface distance measured at 18mm - appropriate safety margin for microwave ablation.

Microwave ablation antenna (Medtronic Emprint system, 15mm active tip) advanced through extended working channel to target center. Pre-ablation checklist completed including: airway clearance verified, antenna position confirmed, impedance check normal (85 ohms), safety zone confirmed without major vessels in immediate ablation field.

Microwave ablation commenced with following parameters:
- Power: 65 watts
- Duration: 6 minutes
- Mode: standard tissue
- Temperature monitoring: peak temperature 92°C at antenna tip

During ablation, patient remained remarkably stable with no hemodynamic changes. No arrhythmias noted. Respiratory mechanics unchanged. 

Post-ablation radial EBUS performed showing hyperechoic region replacing previously hypoechoic tumor, consistent with coagulation necrosis. Ablation zone appeared to extend adequately beyond visible tumor margins.

Equipment removed sequentially with careful airway inspection showing:
- Mild erythema at peripheral catheter contact sites
- No ulceration or mucosal disruption  
- No hemorrhage
- Small amount of serous fluid (<5mL)

Remainder of bronchoscopy unremarkable. Patient emerged from anesthesia smoothly. Extubated after meeting standard criteria. Transferred to recovery area with oxygen saturation 93% on room air (baseline similar per chart review).

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS: Minimal (<5mL)
FLUIDS: 750mL crystalloid  
COMPLICATIONS: None during procedure
SPECIMENS: None sent
DEVICES: Medtronic superDimension navigation, Emprint microwave system

IMPRESSION:
Technically successful bronchoscopic electromagnetic navigation with microwave ablation of right middle lobe peripheral adenocarcinoma in 64-year-old woman with multiple comorbidities precluding surgical resection.

PLAN GOING FORWARD:
Patient admitted to pulmonary step-down unit for monitoring. Initial portable chest X-ray showed no pneumothorax. CT chest with contrast performed this evening showed appropriate ablation zone without immediate complications. Patient doing well with minimal pain (3/10) controlled with oral acetaminophen. Planning discharge tomorrow with:

- Close outpatient follow-up in 1 week with repeat chest X-ray
- CT chest at 6-8 weeks for initial response assessment (expecting to see decrease in size of ablation zone with central low attenuation)  
- PET-CT in 3 months to assess metabolic response (successful ablation should show minimal or no FDG uptake)
- Long-term surveillance CT every 3 months for first year, then every 6 months

Patient counseled extensively on post-ablation syndrome (fever, flu-like symptoms possible for 3-5 days - normal inflammatory response). Instructed on warning signs for complications. Patient and husband expressed gratitude and understanding of plan.

Time spent in procedure: 78 minutes
Time spent in pre/post procedure counseling: 35 minutes

Dictated and electronically signed: Michael Steinberg, MD
Date: 11/02/2025 at 1847 hours

changes: Added coding_review v1 with CPT/RVU summary (no CPT changes).

cpt_summary.description: Tube thoracostomy (chest tube) with water seal drainage
Bronchoscopy with destruction of tumor or relief of stenosis by any method
Bronchoscopy, diagnostic, with cell washing when performed
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)
Bronchoscopy with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation (add-on)

coding_review.rationale: Electromagnetic navigation with radial EBUS-guided microwave ablation of a right middle lobe tumor plus prophylactic chest tube placement supports 31641 for tumor ablation, 31627 for navigation, 31654 for radial EBUS, 32551 for chest tube insertion, and a diagnostic bronchoscopy component 31622 that will typically bundle under 31641 on the final claim.

note_text: This seventy-three year old female patient Catherine Martinez (medical record JJ-8374-Q, born September 8, 1951) presented for electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy targeting a left upper lobe peripheral nodule measuring twenty-three millimeters in greatest dimension on computed tomography. The lesion demonstrated a positive bronchus sign and had a standardized uptake value of five point two on positron emission tomography imaging suggesting malignancy. She underwent moderate conscious sedation with intravenous midazolam three milligrams and fentanyl one hundred micrograms achieving a Ramsay sedation score of three. Her blood pressure was monitored at ten minute intervals throughout and remained stable in the one twenties to one thirties over seventies to eighties. Oxygen saturation was continuously monitored and stayed above ninety-five percent on room air. The electromagnetic navigation system was utilized with successful registration to the preoperative CT scan. The guide sheath was advanced to the left upper lobe apical-posterior segment and the radial endobronchial ultrasound probe confirmed tool-in-lesion position with a concentric echogenic pattern consistent with solid tissue. Total fluoroscopy time was five point one minutes with a dose area product of one hundred ninety-two centigray centimeters squared. Sampling included three needle aspirations using a twenty-one gauge needle, four transbronchial forceps biopsies, and two brush cytology specimens. There was minimal bleeding after the forceps biopsies which resolved spontaneously with gentle suction. Post-procedure chest radiograph showed no pneumothorax or significant change from baseline. The patient tolerated the procedure well and was discharged home after two hours of observation in stable condition.

changes: Replaced diagnostic bronchoscopy code 31622 with transbronchial lung biopsy code 31624 based on documented forceps biopsies; added coding_review v1.
warnings: Could not extract valid procedure date (was 1951-09-08)

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage and transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy with brushing or protected brushings
Bronchoscopy with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation (add-on)

coding_review.rationale: Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy with radial EBUS confirming a left upper lobe lesion, three needle aspirations, four transbronchial forceps biopsies, and two brushings supports 31624 for transbronchial lung biopsies, 31623 for brush cytology, and add-on navigation code 31627.
documentation_issues: Procedure date appears to equal DOB (1951-09-08); true procedure date is not documented.

note_text:
Pt: Christopher Lee
Medical Record Number: KJ-7482-N
Date of Birth: 10/18/1955

COMPLEX INDICATION: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy + LLL peripheral infiltrate (? ILD vs malignancy)

GENERAL ANESTHESIA: ETT, sevoflurane maintenance, Ramsay 6
Continuous monitoring with arterial line

PART 1 - EBUS FOR LYMPH NODES:
Station 4R: 13mm, 3 passes, ROSE shows non-necrotizing granulomas
Station 7: 16mm, 4 passes, ROSE shows similar granulomatous inflammation
Station 11L: 9mm, 3 passes, ROSE adequate

Staging indication: No (diagnostic, not staging)
Systematic sequence: No (targeted approach based on imaging)
All sampled nodes adequate: Yes

PART 2 - TRANSBRONCHIAL CRYOBIOPSY:
LLL peripheral infiltrate sampled with cryoprobe
- Cryobiopsies ×4 from different LLL subsegments
- Each biopsy: 6-second freeze time
- Prophylactic bronchial blocker placed before cryobiopsies
- Samples 4-6mm each, well-preserved architecture

SAFETY EVENTS:
- Moderate bleeding after 2nd cryobiopsy (expected)
- Controlled with blocker inflation + iced saline
- Bleeding resolved, blocker removed
- No pneumothorax on immediate post-procedure CXR

Procedure time: 67 minutes

Patient extubated in OR, recovered well, admitted for overnight observation per cryobiopsy protocol.

PATHOLOGY PENDING: Both lymph node and lung parenchymal samples for comprehensive evaluation.

changes: Added CPT codes 31653 and 31628 for 3-station EBUS-TBNA and LLL transbronchial cryobiopsies; added coding_review v1.
warnings: Could not extract valid procedure date (was 1955-10-18)

Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe

note_text:

PRIMARY INDICATION: Mediastinal lymph node staging
TARGET PATHOLOGY: Right lower lobe adenocarcinoma (biopsy-proven)

ANESTHESIA PROTOCOL:
└─ Agent: Midazolam IV
   ├─ Dose: 2mg initial, 1mg supplemental at T+15min
   └─ Total: 3mg
└─ Agent: Fentanyl IV
   ├─ Dose: 50mcg initial, 25mcg supplemental at T+20min
   └─ Total: 75mcg
└─ Sedation Level: Ramsay Scale maximum 3
└─ Monitoring Frequency: BP q5min, continuous SpO2

EBUS-TBNA STATIONS SAMPLED:
├─ Station 4R
│  ├─ Size: 10mm short-axis
│  ├─ Passes: 4
│  ├─ ROSE: Positive for malignant cells
│  └─ PET: Positive (SUV 6.2)
├─ Station 7
│  ├─ Size: 15mm short-axis
│  ├─ Passes: 4
│  ├─ ROSE: Positive for malignant cells

└─ Station 10R
   ├─ Size: 7mm short-axis
   ├─ Passes: 3

QUALITY METRICS:

├─ Photodocumentation all accessible stations: YES
├─ ROSE adequacy all sampled nodes: YES
├─ Molecular testing samples obtained: YES (from station 7)
└─ Protocol adherence: 100%

ADVERSE EVENTS:
└─ None (Grade 0)

DIAGNOSTIC YIELD: Pending final pathology (preliminary: N2 disease confirmed)

PATIENT IDENTIFIERS (SYNTHETIC):
Name: Robert Anderson | MRN: KK-9473-L | DOB: 05/19/1956

changes: Removed unsupported transbronchial needle aspiration code 31629 (no lung parenchymal biopsy documented), retained 31653 for nodal EBUS-TBNA with optional diagnostic bronchoscopy 31622, corrected procedure_date to 2024-10-15 from DOB, and added coding_review v1.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy, diagnostic, with cell washing when performed
Bronchoscopy with EBUS-TBNA sampling of 3 or more mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

coding_review.rationale: The registry study note describes EBUS-TBNA staging of stations 4R, 7, and 10R without any transbronchial lung biopsy; 31629 was therefore removed, while 31653 captures the nodal EBUS and 31622 is retained as an optional diagnostic bronchoscopy that will typically bundle under 31653.

note_text:
Patient: Robert Martinez  MRN: KL-847-92  DOB: 07/22/1958
Procedure Date: 09/15/2024

INDICATION: Mediastinal staging for newly diagnosed right upper lobe lung adenocarcinoma. PET-CT shows FDG-avid mediastinal lymphadenopathy.

SEDATION: Moderate sedation achieved with midazolam 3mg IV + fentanyl 75mcg IV. Patient remained Ramsay 3 throughout procedure. Continuous SpO2 monitoring maintained >95%. Blood pressure checked every 5 minutes per protocol.

PROCEDURE:
Systematic EBUS-TBNA evaluation performed following N3→N2→N1 sequence. Photodocumentation of all accessible lymph node stations completed prior to sampling.

Stations sampled:
- Station 4R: Short axis 12mm, 4 needle passes, ROSE positive for malignant cells, PET+
- Station 7: Short axis 18mm, 4 needle passes, ROSE positive for malignant cells, PET+
- Station 10R: Short axis 8mm, 3 needle passes, ROSE adequate, PET-
- Station 11R: Short axis 6mm, 3 needle passes, ROSE adequate, PET-

COMPLICATIONS: None. No bleeding, no desaturation events.

IMPRESSION: EBUS-TBNA with adequate sampling of mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes for complete staging evaluation.

changes: Removed unsupported transbronchial needle aspiration code 31629 (no lung parenchymal biopsy documented); retained 31653 for multistation EBUS-TBNA and added coding_review v1.

cpt_summary.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS-TBNA sampling of 3 or more mediastinal and/or hilar lymph node stations

coding_review.rationale: Systematic EBUS-TBNA staging with sampling of 4R, 7, 10R, and 11R lymph node stations is appropriately captured by 31653; no transbronchial lung biopsy is described, so 31629 was removed.

note_text:
Patient: Angela Davis
MR Number: KP-9274-B
D.O.B.: 05/12/1970

Indication: Evaluation of LLL infiltrate, r/o endobronchial lesion

Topical anesthesia only: Nebulized lidocaine 4% + transtracheal 2% injection
Patient awake and cooperative, Ramsay 1-2

Findings:
- Upper airways normal
- Carina sharp, mobile
- RUL/RML/RLL - all subsegments examined, normal
- LUL - normal
- LLL - moderate erythema and edema of basilar segments, no endobronchial lesion

Samples obtained from LLL:
- BAL ×3 (50cc aliquots) sent for bacterial cx, fungal cx, viral PCR, cytology
- Brush cytology ×2 from affected area
- Transbronchial biopsies not performed (patient preference)

Systematic airway inspection: 100% of accessible airways examined and documented

No complications. Procedure time 18 minutes. Patient discharged after brief recovery.

changes: Aligned CPT codes with documentation: removed transbronchial biopsy codes 31628 and 31624 (biopsies explicitly not performed) and added diagnostic bronchoscopy 31622 plus brushing code 31623; added coding_review v1.

coding_review.rationale: The report describes a diagnostic bronchoscopy with complete airway inspection, BAL samples, and brush cytology from the LLL, and explicitly states that transbronchial biopsies were not performed; this supports 31622 and 31623, while 31628 and 31624 were removed.
